skill.name: marketplace-release
skill.description: Use when creating releases for Claude Code plugin marketplaces. Supports independent plugin versioning - each plugin can be released separately. Triggered by "release", "bump version", "create release", "publish plugin".
skill.summary: Use when creating releases for Claude Code plugin marketplaces. Supports independent plugin versioni...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown skill with no executable code. Provides documentation and prompts for release automation. All actual operations are performed by the external release.py Python script.

content.value_statement: Managing plugin releases manually is error-prone and time-consuming. This skill automates the entire release workflow including version bumps, git commits, tags, and GitHub releases for Claude Code marketplaces.
actual_capabilities: Bump plugin versions using semantic versioning (patch, minor, major)
Validate plugins before release using claude plugin validate
Create git commits and version-specific tags automatically
Push commits and tags to remote repository
Generate GitHub releases with installation instructions
List all plugins with their current versions
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI authentication with gh auth login
Must run from marketplace root directory
Does not create new plugins or marketplaces from scratch
Cannot release without uncommitted changes being addressed

use_cases.title: Release plugin updates
use_cases.description: Automate the release workflow for marketplace plugins with proper versioning and changelog generation.

use_cases.title: Version bump workflow
use_cases.description: Standardize version bumps across plugins with consistent release notes and git tag conventions.

use_cases.title: CI release automation
use_cases.description: Integrate release automation into CI pipelines for hands-free plugin publishing.

prompt_templates.title: Basic patch release
prompt_templates.prompt: Use marketplace-release to create a patch release for [plugin-name] with message "[brief description of fix]"

prompt_templates.title: Feature release
prompt_templates.prompt: Use marketplace-release to bump [plugin-name] with a minor version and add "[new feature description]" as the release notes

prompt_templates.title: Major breaking release
prompt_templates.prompt: Use marketplace-release to create a major release for [plugin-name] with "[breaking change description]" in the notes

prompt_templates.title: List versions
prompt_templates.prompt: Use marketplace-release to list all plugins and their current versions in the marketplace

output_examples.input: Use marketplace-release to create a patch release for ghe with "Fix avatar loading issue"
output: Changes to be committed: marketplace.json, plugin.json, version references
Ready to push to remote and create GitHub release

best_practices: Validate plugins with claude plugin validate before running release
Use descriptive release notes that explain what changed
Run from the marketplace root directory to avoid path errors
anti_patterns: Running release without reviewing the changes first
Ignoring validation errors in the plugin structure

faq.question: What versions of Claude Code are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code desktop and CLI versions 1.0 and later. Supports both claude and claude-code tools.

faq.question: How many plugins can be released at once?
faq.answer: The script releases one plugin per command. Use independent versioning to manage multiple plugins in one marketplace.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. The script can run in CI with proper gh authentication. Use environment variables for non-interactive releases.

faq.question: Is my data safe during release?
faq.answer: The script only modifies your git repository. It commits and pushes changes you specify. Review prompts before confirming.

faq.question: What if the release fails mid-process?
faq.answer: The script prompts for confirmation before major steps. Git operations are atomic. Check git status after any failure.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual releases?
faq.answer: Automates version bumps, commit messages, tag creation, and GitHub release notes. Reduces human error and saves time.
